alert.note: Alert for Blue Earth; Brown; Nicollet (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 24 at 9:15PM CDT until May 25 at 4:52PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River at Savage affecting Dakota, Carver, Scott and Hennepin Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River At New Ulm affecting Brown, Blue Earth and Nicollet Counties. Minnesota River At Morton affecting Redwood and Renville Counties. Minnesota River at Montevideo affecting Lac qui Parle, Chippewa and Yellow Medicine Counties. .Additional rainfall over locations already in flood stage will stagnate river level drops over the next few days. Locations not in flood stage will bump closer as rainfall accumulates. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Minnesota River At New Ulm. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 845 PM CDT Tuesday, the stage was 800.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 845 PM CDT Tuesday was 800.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 796.7 feet Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 800.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 799.8 feet on 10/09/2017. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
